reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision of Emergency WASH Services to Informal Camps- Settlements and Health Facilities in Idleb and Aleppo Governorates

description.narrative:
Qatar Charity (QC) with implementing partner Ihsan Relief and Development (IRD) will provide 50,730 individuals with WASH services. The project’s interventions are designed to continue providing the services of project TUR-19/3559/RA3/WASH/NGO/14904 in the two main interventions: Continue in providing Emergency WASH services for the displaced persons in informal settlements located in Dana Sub-district due to the influx of IDPs from Al Mara in December 2019.
Continue in providing WASH services for eight health facilities in Dana, Atareb, Daret Azza , Shamarine and Azaz Sub-districts. The project will provide 13,380 IDP's living in 21 informal settlements and camps in Idleb and Aleppo governorates with all basic WASH services considering COVID-19 mitigation measures, by the provision of adequate drinking water via water trucking (35ltr/PD/pp) while constantly assuring the quality of the water through chlorination and tested, storage water tanks, solid waste removal, provision waste containers, de-sludging latrine septic tanks. This project also will hold segregated sessions for men, women, and children to raise personal and environmental hygiene awareness in general and to apply prevention measures of COVID-19.
The project activities have been modified from the previous one in order to be in line with the COVID-19 guidance of the WASH Cluster proposed and revised interventions/activities as the following: Increasing the water trucking quantity from 25 liters to 35 liters per person per day to allow extra handwashing. Installation of additional extra water tanks. Increasing the frequency of solid waste collection and distribute additional garbage bins. Distribution of Latrine Cleaning Materials Kit(Liquid chlorine , Liquid soap ,sprayer, Flash. Distribution hygiene promotion materials such as posters and banner in camps at WASH facility and highly visible locations.
As response of COVID-19 eight health facilities will be served with the WASH services’ either running cost or maintenance cost as the following: Repair/ renovate existing WASH facilities including replacement of dysfunctional handwashing basins, taps, showers, toilet seats. Provision safe and adequate water . Installation of soap container per each handwashing unit. Installation of handwashing units Soap procurement and refilling. Provision of desludging or connect to existing wastewater collection if needed. Provision of solid waste collection, separation, and disposal services with attention to sanitary disposal system Support WASH facilities cleaning. Spraying and facility disinfection with liquid chlorine. The project's interventions have put strong emphasis and providing emergency WASH service that can meet the different needs of men, women, boys, and girls with full consideration of the specific needs of the most vulnerable groups women, children, elderlies and people with a disability, in providing the project's services (latrines, washing facilities, etc). Female staff will be recruited to facilitate communication and consultation between the project’s staff with women and girls. The project will hire women and men and provide them with cleaning tools and materials to clean latrines in the targeted camps to sustain those latrines and keep them clean for use by the whole people in the targeted locations.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
